Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tranexamic Acid in Major Abdominal Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: multicenter, double-blind, placebo-controlled, randomised superiority trial involves 850 patients

Participants.evidence: 850 patients aged 18 years or older undergoing elective esophagectomy, gastrectomy, colectomy, rectal resection, pancreatic resection, or hepatectomy across eleven academic hospitals in Germany

Intervention.evidence: randomised 1:1 to receive either TXA (1000 mg bolus before incision, 125 mg/h until closure) or placebo

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome is the need for transfusion of at least one unit of PRBCs, measured intra- or postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation is computer-generated with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding includes patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Recruitment began on June 17, 2024, with completion expected by November 2025.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis will follow an intention-to-treat approach.

Trial_Registration.evidence: trial registration EU CT Nr: 2023–509970-43–01, NCT06414031

Funding.evidence: Funding is provided by institutional grants.
